title: City of Hope Cancer Treatment Centers
description: From state-of-the-art cancer treatments to supportive therapies that target side effects, our integrative, comprehensive care is delivered by a team of specialists and other cancer experts, all under one roof.
sitename: City of Hope Cancer Treatment Centers
cleaned_text: As a world-renowned research institution and the founding member of the National Comprehensive Care Network, City of Hope is at the forefront of the next generation of treatments, serving as a leader in the delivery of personalized, whole-person care. And we're closer than ever. City of Hope, a 100+-year-old world leader in cancer research, treatment and prevention, joined forces with Cancer Treatment Centers of America® (CTCA), uniting a shared vision, values and commitment to high-quality, compassionate care that puts the patient first—at our hospitals, Comprehensive Care Centers and Outpatient Care Centers across the United States. Surrounding yourself with a team of cancer doctors allows you to get the answers you need to make informed decisions about your care, with the sense of urgency you deserve. If you've been diagnosed with cancer, or you're already undergoing treatment, and you're unsure of what to do, our cancer doctors will work with you to design a treatment plan that's personalized for your diagnosis and your individual needs, treating not just the disease but also helping you manage side effects and get back to life. Click the links below to learn more about our cancer treatment experts Other than skin cancer, the five most common cancers in the United States are breast cancer, prostate cancer, lung cancer, colorectal cancer and melanoma. But there are more than 100 cancer types and subtypes. At City of Hope, our experts treat all stages of cancer, from early-stage disease to rare and complex cancers. Learn more about the different types of cancer we treat, including information on symptoms, risk factors and more. A second opinion may point to a different cancer type, and a review of your genetic profile through advanced genomic testing may uncover a more advanced treatment option not previously considered, or help to confirm your current diagnosis and treatment plan. One in three men and women will develop cancer in their lifetime. Forty-two percent of cancer cases diagnosed in the United States are potentially preventable trough lifestyle changes and/or regular screenings. City of Hope developed a cancer risk assessment using the gold standard of clinical guidelines—free for you to take online right now. We strive to make becoming at patient at City of Hope as easy and stress free as possible. Get to know what your experience will be like as a City of Hope
